com.hannesdorfmann.mosby.testing.presenter

Class MvpLcePresenterTest<M,V extends MvpLceView<M>,P extends MvpPresenter<V>>

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.hannesdorfmann.mosby.testing.presenter.MvpLcePresenterTest<M,V,P>

  • public abstract class MvpLcePresenterTest<M,V extends MvpLceView<M>,P extends MvpPresenter<V>>
extends java.lang.Object
    A simple MVP LCE (Loading Content Error) Unit test for Presenter to ensure that showLoading(), showContent() and setData() will be called correctly as expected
    Since:
    1.0.0

      Invoked to load data
      protected void startLceTests(boolean pullToRefreshSupported)
      Starts the unit unit test by checking if showError(), showContent() and showLoading() is invoked correctly and that the expected data of setData() is as expected.

    • Constructor Detail

      • MvpLcePresenterTest

        public MvpLcePresenterTest()

    • Method Detail

      • beforeTestNotFailing

        protected abstract void beforeTestNotFailing()
        Called to indicate that we are testing the successful way. So we expect that the presenter calls showContent() and setData(). You may have to manipulate your business logic objects (like http component) to ensure that NO ERROR is thrown.

      • beforeTestFailing

        protected abstract void beforeTestFailing()
        Called to indicate that we are testing errors. So we expect that the presenter calls showError(). You may have to manipulate your business logic objects (like http component) to ensure an error is thrown that is handled by the presenter properly

      • startLceTests

        protected void startLceTests(boolean pullToRefreshSupported)
        Starts the unit unit test by checking if showError(), showContent() and showLoading() is invoked correctly and that the expected data of setData() is as expected.
        Parameters:
        pullToRefreshSupported - Does this presenter supports pull to refresh. If true, pull to refresh will also be tested

      • createViewMock

        protected V createViewMock()
        Create a new view mock instance

      • freshPresenter

        protected P freshPresenter()

      • getViewClass

        protected abstract java.lang.Class<V> getViewClass()
        Get the class of the view (the view interface)

      • createPresenter

        protected abstract P createPresenter()
        Get the presenter instance

      • loadData

        protected abstract void loadData(P presenter,
            boolean pullToRefresh)
        Invoked to load data
        Parameters:
        presenter - the presenter where you should call the loading method

      • verifyData

        protected abstract void verifyData(M data)
        Called to verify that data that has been set to the view by MvpLceView.setData(Object)
        Parameters:
        data - The data
